<html><body><div><div itemprop="articleBody"><p class="mol-para-with-font">A scandalous new docudrama based on America's early presidents may shock history buffs with its unflinching look inside the walls of the country's most famous residence. </p><p class="mol-para-with-font">Titled The <a target="_self" href="/news/white-house/index.html" id="mol-9e8e09c0-0156-11f1-ac24-bb2be1b12b16">White House</a>, the eight-part Fox Nation series revisits early American history through the lens of the White House itself.</p><p class="mol-para-with-font">Rather than concentrating solely on public events, the show explores the intimate spaces shared by presidents, their families, advisers, and rivals – and promises to expose the most jaw-dropping moments that took place behind closed doors.</p><p class="mol-para-with-font">The series begins in 1800 with the arrival of its first occupant, Founding Father and second U.S. President John Adams, and traces the evolution of the executive residence alongside the growing pains of a deeply divided young nation.  </p><p class="mol-para-with-font">In one shocking episode, Adams discovers his oldest son Charles in bed with another man.</p><p class="mol-para-with-font">In an exclusive preview shared exclusively with Daily Mail, a furious Adams barges into Charles' bedroom and finds empty bottles of <a target="_self" href="/news/alcohol/index.html" id="mol-9e88d9a0-0156-11f1-ac24-bb2be1b12b16">alcohol</a> on the dresser and bedside tables.</p><div class="artSplitter mol-img-group">  <p class="imageCaption">A scandalous new historical docudrama The White House will reveal the wild secrets from inside the nation's most iconic residence</p></div><p class="mol-para-with-font">He then marches over to the bed to pull back the covers, where he finds a stunned Charles next to a naked man.</p><p class="mol-para-with-font">'You BEAST!' he screams at his son. 'I renounce you!'</p><p class="mol-para-with-font">Although Charles was married with two children, it was well documented that he had 'close relationships' with other men – much to the chagrin of his father.</p><p class="mol-para-with-font">The series also covers the true stories of other historical figures including Abigail Adams, Thomas Jefferson, Sally Hemings, Dolley Madison, Aaron Burr, and Alexander Hamilton, presenting lesser-known accounts and personal dynamics that influenced American history.</p><p class="mol-para-with-font">Announcing the series, FOX Nation president Lauren Petterson said the project offers viewers a fresh perspective on familiar history.</p><p class="mol-para-with-font">'While Americans know the broad strokes of our nation's history, this series provides a revealing new perspective on what unfolded inside the president's home during its earliest years,' she said in a statement.</p><p class="mol-para-with-font">'We are thrilled to share this gripping and immersive look inside the American legacy.'</p><p class="mol-para-with-font">Produced by Nutopia, the series is showrun by Jim Greayer, with Hereward Pelling serving as director. Executive producers include Ben Goold and Jane Root.</p><div class="artSplitter mol-img-group">  <p class="imageCaption">In an early episode, Founding Father John Adams finds his son Charles in bed with a naked man</p></div><div class="artSplitter mol-img-group">  <p class="imageCaption">'You BEAST!' a furious Adams screams at his stunned son. 'I renounce you!'</p></div><p class="mol-para-with-font">Daily Mail has an exclusive first-look at the series along with episodic descriptions.</p><p class="mol-para-with-font">The White House will begin streaming on Fox Nation from February 6.  </p><p class="mol-para-with-font"><span class="mol-style-bold">Episode 1 – 'Under This Roof'</span></p><p class="mol-para-with-font">In a half-built mansion surrounded by mud and mosquitoes, President John Adams struggles to govern a fledgling nation. As personal tragedy and public scandal collide, Vice President Thomas Jefferson quietly wages a ruthless smear campaign. With his presidency under siege, Adams faces heartbreak at home and betrayal in office.</p><p class="mol-para-with-font"><span class="mol-style-bold">Episode 2 – 'Friends Disunited'</span></p><p class="mol-para-with-font">The marriage of John and Abigail Adams strains under the weight of politics and ambition. Meanwhile, Jefferson and Aaron Burr plot their path to power—only to see their alliance begin to unravel. As scandal dominates the press, a bitter election pits former friends against one another.</p><p class="mol-para-with-font"><span class="mol-style-bold">Episode 3 – 'Stuck in the Middle'</span></p><p class="mol-para-with-font">With Jefferson now president, Washington is transformed both politically and socially. Tensions rise, whispers of blackmail spread, and a dangerous secret from Jefferson's private life threatens to explode. Abroad, American ships face deadly threats as the Barbary Wars escalate.</p><p class="mol-para-with-font"><span class="mol-style-bold">Episode 4 – 'Scandals and Lies'</span></p><p class="mol-para-with-font">At Monticello, Jefferson's secrets come to light as his relationship with Sally Hemings is exposed, sending shockwaves through the nation. While the Haitian Revolution looms large and political enemies gather, Jefferson battles to seal the Louisiana Purchase. He learns that the price of power comes steep, sometimes with a devastating price.</p><p class="mol-para-with-font"><span class="mol-style-bold">Episode 5 – 'This Gilded Cage'</span></p><p class="mol-para-with-font">A heartbreaking personal loss leaves Jefferson reeling and alters the course of lives bound to him. As Sally Hemings dreams of freedom and the future, tensions reach a breaking point when the rivalry between Aaron Burr and Alexander Hamilton turns deadly.</p><p class="mol-para-with-font"><span class="mol-style-bold">Episode 6 – 'Dolley's Squeezes'</span></p><p class="mol-para-with-font">As Jefferson steps aside, James and Dolley Madison must find a way to breathe new life into American politics. Melinda Colbert returns to Washington as a free woman, only to find that, yet again, her romance with John Freeman faces impossible odds. Amid tensions abroad and scandals at home, the Madisons emerge as a political force to be reckoned with, keeping their friends close and their enemies closer.</p><p class="mol-para-with-font"><span class="mol-style-bold">Episode 7 – 'The British Are Coming'</span></p><p class="mol-para-with-font">The War of 1812 erupts, throwing American politics into turmoil. Right when America is beset by British forces on land and at sea, James Madison falls gravely ill, and his chances of survival are called into question. Madison's allies must scramble to keep the government from falling apart. As the war with the British ramps up, an attack on Washington appears imminent.</p><p class="mol-para-with-font"><span class="mol-style-bold">Episode 8 – 'Burning Down the House'</span></p><p class="mol-para-with-font">British troops march on Washington as flames engulf the city. While Madison joins the fight, Dolley Madison makes a daring stand to save the White House's most sacred symbols. As the building burns, the survival of both the house and the nation it represents hangs in the balance.</p></div>
